questions.question: A small business owner wants to set up their first office network. They plan to have five employees sharing documents and a printer. Which of the following would be the MOST appropriate basic network setup?
options: A wireless router with built-in switch capabilities and a shared network printer
Five separate mobile hotspots, one for each employee
A single computer with multiple monitors for employees to share
Individual internet connections for each employee's computer

questions.question: A user notices that their computer is running much slower than usual. When they check the task manager, they see that the CPU usage is consistently at 95% even when no applications are open. What is the MOST likely cause of this issue?
options: The computer needs more RAM installed
The hard drive needs to be defragmented
A background process or malware is consuming CPU resources

questions.question: A user needs to transfer large video files between computers that are not connected to the same network. Which of the following would be the MOST efficient method for this task?
options: Use a high-capacity USB flash drive
Upload to social media and download on the other computer
Print the file contents and manually type them in

questions.question: A small office needs to add wireless access for employees and guests. Security is a concern as some confidential data is processed on the network. Which of the following would be the MOST appropriate setup?
options: A single wireless network with WEP encryption
A single wireless network with the SSID hidden
Two separate wireless networks: one for employees with WPA2 and one guest network with limited access
An open wireless network with MAC filtering

questions.question: A user's workstation loses internet connectivity, but they can still access internal network resources. The network administrator confirms that other users can access the internet without issues. Which of the following should be checked FIRST?
options: The internet service provider's outage status

questions.question: A small retail business owner wants to protect their point-of-sale system from power outages that frequently occur in their area. Which device should they purchase?
A user needs to edit a PDF document to update some text and images. Which of the following would be the MOST appropriate software for this task?

A user receives a spreadsheet with thousands of rows of data and needs to find specific information based on multiple criteria. Which of the following features in spreadsheet software would be MOST helpful?
A small business wants to track inventory, customer information, and sales in a single application. Which type of software would be MOST appropriate for this purpose?

A company is developing a new application and needs to ensure it works correctly before release. Which of the following describes the process of checking if the software meets the specified requirements?

A developer needs to create a simple website for a local community organization. The site will contain basic information and contact details. Which of the following would be the MOST appropriate for creating this website?

A small medical office needs to store patient information in a structured way. Which type of database model would be MOST appropriate for organizing related data about patients, appointments, and medical histories?
An employee receives an email that appears to be from their bank, asking them to click a link and verify their account details due to a security issue. What should the employee do?
options: Click the link and provide the requested information to resolve the security issue
Forward the email to their manager to handle
Reply to the email asking for more information
Contact their bank directly using the phone number from their official website or bank card

questions.question: A small business wants to implement basic security measures for their computers. Which of the following combinations would provide the MOST effective basic protection?
options: Antivirus software, regular updates, and strong passwords
Changing the computer names and using screen savers
Installing multiple antivirus programs and sharing passwords for easy support
Disconnecting from the internet and using only local applications

questions.question: An employee needs to create a secure password for their work account. Which of the following would be the MOST secure password?
options: The same password they use for their personal email

questions.question: A company is evaluating the cost of upgrading their computers. They need to consider both the immediate purchase price and the ongoing maintenance costs. Which of the following terms BEST describes this comprehensive cost evaluation?

A local retail store wants to implement a basic technology solution to track inventory and sales. The owner has limited technical knowledge and a small budget. What would be the MOST appropriate approach?
options: Develop a custom enterprise resource planning system
Purchase an off-the-shelf point-of-sale system designed for small retailers
Hire a full-time IT staff member to build a solution
Continue using manual paper-based tracking methods

questions.question: A user reports that their printer is not working. When troubleshooting this issue, which of the following should be checked FIRST?
options: Verify that the printer has power and is connected to the network or computer
Replace the printer with a new model
Check if other users are experiencing similar issues

questions.question: A user cannot connect to the internet on their laptop. The network icon shows that they are connected to the Wi-Fi network, and other devices on the same network can access the internet. Which of the following should be tried FIRST?
A user reports that an application keeps crashing on their computer. Which of the following troubleshooting steps should be tried FIRST?
options: Close other applications and restart the problematic application
